qas.question: Who was the head of the FCC at the time of Comcast's proposed purchase of Time Warner Cable?
What two organizations had Wheeler headed prior to joining the FCC?

answers.text: National Cable & Telecommunications Association, and as largest wireless lobby, CTIA – The Wireless Association

qas.question: What Senate group held hearings on the purchase?
What group sought to investigate the purchase on anti-trust grounds?

answers.text: United States Department of Justice Antitrust Division

qas.question: Who was the general counsel of the FCC in 2015?
Who is the current head of the National Cable and Telecommunications Association?
When was Tom Wheeler the head of the CTIA?
What day did the House Judiciary Committee have its hearing?
Who is the head of Politico?
Who is the chairman of the House Judiciary Committee?

context: Critics noted in <b6_0>2013<b6_0/> that <a0_0><b5_0><b8_0>Tom Wheeler<b8_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, the head of the FCC, which has to approve the deal, is the former head of both the largest cable lobbying organization, the <a1_0>National Cable & Telecommunications Association, and as largest wireless lobby, CTIA – The Wireless Association<a1_0/>. According to Politico, Comcast "donated to almost every member of Congress who has a hand in regulating it." The <a2_0>US Senate Judiciary Committee<a2_0/> held a hearing on the deal on <b7_0>April 9, 2014<b7_0/>. The House Judiciary Committee planned its own hearing. On March 6, 2014 the <a3_0>United States Department of Justice Antitrust Division<a3_0/> confirmed it was investigating the deal. In March 2014, the division's chairman, <b9_0>William Baer<b9_0/>, recused himself because he was involved in a prior Comcast NBCUniversal acquisition. Several states' attorneys general have announced support for the federal investigation. On April 24, 2015, <a4_0>Jonathan Sallet<a4_0/>, general counsel of the F.C.C., said that he was going to recommend a hearing before an administrative law judge, equivalent to a collapse of the deal.
